lead_paragraph: POWERS--Peter J. The Board of Directors of Mutual of America Life Insurance Company, together with its officers and employees, mourn the passing of Peter J. Powers, an esteemed member of the Board of Directors since 2006. Mr. Powers served with distinction on the Law and Corporate Governance and Nominating Committees and was appointed Chair of the Nominating Committee in 2010. Peter Powers founded Powers Global Strategies LLC, a government relations and strategic consulting firm in New York and Washington, D.C. and served as its Chairman and Chief Executive Officer. He had a long and distinguished career as an attorney, Certified Public Accountant, consultant and public servant and served as First Deputy Mayor of the City of New York under Rudolph Giuliani from 1994 to 1996. Highly respected in his field, Mr. Powers served on the boards of numerous civic and charitable organizations including the Partnership for New York City and the United Hospital Fund and was recently elected Secretary of the Council of Governing Boards, a statewide advocacy group for private colleges and universities. Mr. Powers' sound judgment, integrity and wise counsel have been invaluable to Mutual of America and have greatly contributed to its success. We who were privileged to have known him will gratefully remember his unassuming manner, dedication to service and sincere commitment to professional excellence. His wisdom and friendship will be greatly missed. While we mourn his passing, we greatly admire the manner in which he lived his life. Peter Powers, our friend and colleague, will be remembered with profound respect and affection. Thomas J. Moran Chairman of the Board John R. Greed President and Chief Executive Officer Mutual of America Life Insurance Company 1/3
